channel.title: Give & Take - By Cloudstepper [Cinedramatic Trip Hop]
channel.description:
https://soundcloud.com/collectedworks/give-take-5
I live by the loops. Repetition is the name of my game. And strings and drama. We always need drama, especially the bureaucrats among us. Lets us live a little. Go ahead and get lost in it and if you ever make it back, tell me how it felt.
Au revoir,
j.

item.title: Give & Take - By Cloudstepper [Cinedramatic Trip Hop]
item.dc:creator: Cloudstepper
item.description:
Haha thanks! Glad to hear you liked it and felt the drama… hopefully it was the song

item.title: Give & Take - By Cloudstepper [Cinedramatic Trip Hop]
item.dc:creator: BlutoothCutthroat
item.description:
Chillicious CS! I felt the drama in my gut. Or maybe it was the cheese danish… love it! Now got to explore your SC page!

Read full topic
item.source: Give & Take - By Cloudstepper [Cinedramatic Trip Hop]

item.title: Give & Take - By Cloudstepper [Cinedramatic Trip Hop]
item.dc:creator: Cloudstepper
item.description:
Thanks for this! Yeah I kind of agree with you actually… there isn’t exactly a lot of variation in the musical part, more in the arrangement part. Simple, clean, straightforward - partly by intent and partly by lack of sleep (was too tired to come up with more melodies around this theme). But I think I will continue to work on it, as one always does with these songs and I will definitely try and work on some more melodies and to better differentiate the different parts (maybe even by simplifying them further?)… and happy to hear you dig it of course - thanks for taking the time to comment!

j.

Read full topic
item.source: Give & Take - By Cloudstepper [Cinedramatic Trip Hop]

item.title: Give & Take - By Cloudstepper [Cinedramatic Trip Hop]
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
Cool, I like it. Driving, straight forward. The only thing I would have liked to hear perhaps would be when you bring everything back in would be if you explored a counter melody, or a new texture. It would have dropped more variety into the piece.

As it stands though, I dig it

Read full topic
